isis.stitle: AFC 97903 - Refrigerant Compressor Belt Idler Pulley Alignment

afc.subject: Refrigerant Compressor Belt Idler Pulley Alignment

geninfo.para: This AFC applies to the abovementioned models with Detroit Diesel Series 60 engines and air conditioning.

It has been determined that a portion of the idler pulley mounting brackets, Part Number 3514958C1, experienced warpage during a welding operation. Brackets with this condition can cause misalignment of the fixed idler pulley.
The improved idler pulley mounting bracket part number suffix has been raised from "C1" to "C2" (3514958C2).

entry.para: *The original brackets have the 3514958C1 part number stamped into the plate. "C2" brackets can be identified by the absence of the stamped part number in the plate and a wired P/N tag from the PDC's.

svcproc.title: REFRIGERANT COMPRESSOR BELT IDLER PULLEY BRACKET REPLACEMENT PROCEDURE

step1.para: Loosen the four (4) refrigerant compressor mounting bolts that run in the four adjustment slots on the compressor mounting casting and the two (2) mounting bolts that run in the two slots on the compressor adjustment bracket. Back off the adjustment bolt to relieve all belt tension.
Remove the idler pulley from the idler pulley bracket.

Install the new idler pulley bracket, Part Number 3514958C2, by sliding the slotted hole in the bracket behind the lower mounting bolt head and by re-installing the upper mounting bolt through the unslotted hole. Tighten both bolts to 30 to 38 ft-lbs. (40 to 51 Nm).
Re-install the pulley assembly to the threaded boss on the idler bracket. Use a T-50 torx socket to tighten the idler pulley bolt to 25 to 35 ft-lbs. (33 to 47 Nm).

Examine the belt to determine whether or not it can be re-used. Belt replacement is not necessary unless it is damaged and unusable. If the belt is damaged and requires replacement, you may need to continue backing off the adjustment bolt until the new belt (3514954C1) will fit over the pulleys.
With the new or used belt installed, turn the adjustment bolt until all excess slack is taken up. The belt should be loose with no slack. DO NOT APPLY ANY ADDITIONAL TENSION YET.
Tighten all six mounting bolts to 24 ft-lbs. and then back each one off 1/2 turn only.

Mount your Poly V belt tension gauge (ZTOEM 1294) to the top of the belt and turn the adjustment bolt slowly until you reach 120 lbs. of tension for a used belt or 180 lbs. of tension for a new belt. You will notice that it now takes a little more effort to turn the adjustment bolt.
After the correct tension is reached, re-tighten all six refrigerant compressor mounting bolts to 24 ft-lbs. and tighten the jam nut on the adjustment bolt.
Following 2 to 3 minutes of engine operation at high idle with the A/C on, recheck the belt tension with the belt tension gauge. Tension should be no less than 120 lbs.

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

claims.para: Expense is to be charged to Warranty. Claims are to be submitted in the normal manner, making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-97903.

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-97903 activity must be submitted by June 30, 1998 or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after June 30, 1998.
